  1. ä¿®æ”¹ Overleaf é…ç½®ï¼ˆsettings.coffee æˆ– config/settings.coffeeï¼‰ï¼š
    maxFileSize: 20000000  # 20 MB
  1. é‡å¯å®¹å™¨ï¼š
    docker restart <container_name>

ç„¶ååœ¨ LaTeX æ–‡ä»¶é‡Œç›´æ¥å¼•ç”¨ï¼š

è¿™æ ·å®Œå…¨ç»•è¿‡ç½‘é¡µä¸Šä¼ é™åˆ¶ã€‚

è¿™å…¶å®æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªå¾ˆå¸¸è§çš„æ’ç‰ˆé—®é¢˜ã€‚æ ¸å¿ƒæ€è·¯æ˜¯ï¼šä¸è¦ç”¨ \hspace è°ƒæ•´å›¾åƒä½ç½®ï¼Œè€Œç”¨ \centering + subfigure è‡ªå¸¦çš„å¯¹é½æ–¹å¼ã€‚ç„¶åç”¨ \captionsetup æ§åˆ¶å­å›¾æ ‡é¢˜å±…ä¸­ã€‚

ä¸‹é¢ç»™ä½ ä¸€ä¸ªç¤ºä¾‹ï¼ˆé€‚åˆä¸¤æ ï¼‰ï¼š

\documentclass[twocolumn]{article}
\usepackage{graphicx}
\usepackage{subcaption}  % ä½¿ç”¨ subcaption åŒ…
\usepackage{xcolor}

\begin{document}

\begin{figure*}[ht] % figure* è·¨ä¸¤æ ï¼Œå¦‚æœåªåœ¨ä¸€æ ç”¨ figure
    \centering
    % First row
    \begin{subfigure}[b]{0.45\columnwidth} % æ¯ä¸ªå­å›¾å®½åº¦å ä¸€æ å®½åº¦çš„æ¯”ä¾‹
        \centering
        \includegraphics[width=\textwidth]{pic/GDN-1.png}
        \caption{GDN on SWaT}
    \end{subfigure}
    \hfill

        \centering
        \includegraphics[width=\textwidth]{pic/iT-1.png}
        \caption{iTransformer on SWaT}
    \end{subfigure}

    \vspace{1em} % è°ƒæ•´ä¸¤è¡Œä¹‹é—´é—´è·

    \begin{subfigure}[b]{0.45\columnwidth}
        \centering
        \includegraphics[width=\textwidth]{pic/TranAD-1.png}
        \caption{TranAD on SWaT}
    \end{subfigure}
    \hfill

        \centering
        \includegraphics[width=\textwidth]{pic/PGTN-1.png}
        \caption{PGTN on SWaT}
    \end{subfigure}

    \caption{\color{green} Visualization of the time-series outputs of four models on the LIT101 variable from the SWaT dataset. Figure compares the anomaly detection performance of the GDN, iTransformer, TranAD, and our proposed model. In the figure, the red line represents the predicted sequence, the black line the true sequence, the green line the anomaly score, and the red dots indicate the dimensions contributing to the anomaly score.}
    \label{fig:4subfigs}
\end{figure*}

\end{document}
